abstract: The downgrade came with Spain emerging as a looming problem for Europe, with fears that the country will be next in line for a huge bailout, after Greece.
snippet: The downgrade came with Spain emerging as a looming problem for Europe, with fears that the country will be next in line for a huge bailout, after Greece.
lead_paragraph: Standard & Poor’s downgraded Spain’s credit rating on Thursday, saying that the country’s sovereign debt levels were too high and that its banks would need an infusion of aid as the country’s economy contracted.

headline.main: S.&P. Cuts Its Rating on Spain, Citing Debt
